info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 26 at 8:21AM CDT until July 26 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT FOR EASTERN WINNEBAGO...MCHENRY AND BOONE COUNTIES... At 819 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Poplar Grove to near Rockford Airport, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported trees downed along the state line near Beloit, WI. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Rockford, Crystal Lake, Beloit, Lake in the Hills, Belvidere, Woodstock, Huntley, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Roscoe, Harvard, South Beloit, Rockton, Marengo, Poplar Grove, Rockford Airport, Hampshire, Candlewick Lake, Wonder Lake and Lakewood. This includes... Boone County Fairgrounds, Mchenry County Fairgrounds, Rock Cut State Park, Rock Valley College, Rockford Rivets Baseball, and Rockford Speedway. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 115 and 123. I-90 between mile markers 0 and 41. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
